comment: "Enjoyed working with them. Timely and courteous, despite a bit of back and forth confusion. Great graphics."

relationship: Solicited pitch (editor asked you to pitch)

comment: "Pain in the @ss client. The editor is professional, but has this really confusing, times-taking way of processing edits: You have to load each revision into the body of an email using a color-coded, bolding system with parenthetical notes inside the copy. She also added an additional interview in her edit requests. (If I'd known two interviews were required, I would have asked for a higher rate.) Before writing, I asked if there was a contract & she said no; after the piece was edited, she sent a contract that she said I had to sign if I wanted to be paid. The contract not only demanded full work for hire rights (I'd sold first-run) but also demanded I never write about the topic or anything connected to it again. I told her I of course couldn't sign that. For the next month, she continued saying they wouldn't pay until I signed. Then she sent an "alternate" contract that asked for the exact same rights as the first! Took three months to get paid."
relationship: Referral (you had a connection who connected you to the editor)

paidYet: Haven't gotten it yet (as of this reporting)

comment: "The piece hasn't been published yet, but I was paid a month after I submitted the invoice."
